  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void cleanup()
    cleanup removes the temp dir that was created This method will not throw an exception if it cannot remove the files/directory, but will print a msg.

      Parameters:
      pCommand -
      pCommandLineArgs -
      pWorkingDir -
      pRelativeLibRootDir -
      pDllsToLoad - list of paths to dlls, libs, and execs that should be on the classpath that are needed to run the command. These should be coming from a jar that wrapped up everything needed. That jar should have a root directory.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • setRelativeRootLibDir

      public final void setRelativeRootLibDir​(java.lang.String pAbstractLibRootDir)
      setRelativeRootLibDir sets the name of the root part of the relative path found in the jar that includes the libs and execs to be copied over.
      Parameters:
      pAbstractLibRootDir -

    • setWorkingDir

      public final java.lang.String setWorkingDir() throws java.lang.Exception
      setWorkingDir sets the working directory. It uses java's default mechanism to define it. If you use this mechanism, set the relativeRootLibDir first so that the tempDir includes the relativeRootLibDir. If you don't set the root dir, a unique id is created. In windows, this will be under /Users/you/AppData/Local/Temp/[$relativeRootLibDir]
      Parameters:
      pWorkingDir -
      Returns:
      String
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • setWorkingDir

      public final void setWorkingDir​(java.lang.String pWorkingDir) throws java.lang.Exception
      setWorkingDir sets the working directory. If you set this yourself, make sure the process will have the ability to write and read from it. if this directory does not yet exist, it creates it.
      Parameters:
      pWorkingDir -
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • processOnce

      public final java.lang.String processOnce​(java.lang.String pInputString) throws java.io.IOException
      processOnce sends the inputString to the process and returns what returns from the processe's std output This method is expecting that once this has been called, the input has been sent to the external process, the external process will die after sending back its output. This method relies on having some simplistic handshaking communication between the exeternal process and this process. Specificaly, this method "listens" and continues to read from the external process's output until it sees the END_OF_PROCESS_PROCESSING marker seen. If the external process does not send this when it finishes processing, this method will continue to wait for-ever. Likewise, the external process will need a signal from this process to stop listening for input and start processing. Therefore, this method will send an END_OF_INPUT message at the end of each input sent in.
      Parameters:
      pInputString -
      Returns:
      String
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • process

      public final java.lang.String process​(java.lang.String pInputString) throws java.io.IOException
      process sends the inputString to the process and returns what returns from the processe's std output This method relies on having some simplistic handshaking communication between the exeternal process and this process. Specificaly, this method "listens" and continues to read from the external process's output until it sees the END_OF_PROCESS_PROCESSING marker seen. If the external process does not send this when it finishes processing, this method will continue to wait for-ever. Likewise, the external process will need a signal from this process to stop listening for input and start processing. Therefore, this method will send an END_OF_INPUT message at the end of each input sent in.
      Parameters:
      pInputString -
      pProcessOnce -
      Returns:
      String
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
